org.jenkinsci.plugins.JIRADefectLogger

Class DefectPublisher.DescriptorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • hudson.model.Descriptor<T>
      • hudson.tasks.BuildStepDescriptor<hudson.tasks.Publisher>
        • org.jenkinsci.plugins.JIRADefectLogger.DefectPublisher.DescriptorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    hudson.model.Saveable
    Enclosing class:
    DefectPublisher

    @Extension
public static final class DefectPublisher.DescriptorImpl
extends hudson.tasks.BuildStepDescriptor<hudson.tasks.Publisher>
    Descriptor for DefectPublisher. Used as a singleton. The class is marked as public so that it can be accessed from views.

    See src/main/resources/hudson/plugins/hello_world/HelloWorldBuilder/*.jelly for the actual HTML fragment for the configuration screen.

      Constructor and Description
      DefectPublisher.DescriptorImpl()

    • Method Detail

      • doCheckUrl

        public hudson.util.FormValidation doCheckUrl(@QueryParameter
                                    String url,
                                    @QueryParameter
                                    String username,
                                    @QueryParameter
                                    String password)
                                      throws IOException,
                                             javax.servlet.ServletException
        Performs on-the-fly validation of the form field 'name'.
        Parameters:
        value - This parameter receives the value that the user has typed.
        Returns:
        Indicates the outcome of the validation. This is sent to the browser.

        Note that returning FormValidation.error(String) does not prevent the form from being saved. It just means that a message will be displayed to the user.

        Throws:
        IOException
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • getUseFrench

        public boolean getUseFrench()
        This method returns true if the global configuration says we should speak French. The method name is bit awkward because global.jelly calls this method to determine the initial state of the checkbox by the naming convention.
